care.title: Care Instructions â€” Goalkeeping Gloves
care.subtitle: Protect your gloves and extend their life with simple, effective care techniques.
care.videoDescription: Watch how small adjustments in your diving technique can extend glove life.
care.guideTitle: A 7-Step Guide to Wash Your Gloves the Right Way
care.guideIntro: As highly technological and delicate products, goalkeeper gloves deserve special attention. Follow these steps to maximize performance and durability.
care.step1.title: 1. Choose the right gloves for your needs
care.step1.text: Take gloves that are made for the type of surface you regularly play on and the weather conditions you face most. Select the palm foam that best corresponds to your needs â€” even though all B2 palms are high quality, they differ in grip, cushioning and durability. Check additional features such as finger protection, preferred cut, and pick the correct size.
care.step2.title: 2. Wash before first use
care.step2.text: Never forget this: to remove any residual substances from production, clean the gloves with warm water before first use. Only after this do the gloves reach their fullest grip properties.
care.step3.title: 3. Clean after playing
care.step3.text: Wash the gloves with warm water (around 35Âº) after playing to remove dirt that reduces grip. Do not use aggressive solvents or harsh cleaners. Hand wash only â€” do not machine wash. For best results, use a dedicated glove wash.
care.step4.title: 4. Dry at room temperature
care.step4.text: Let the gloves dry at room temperature. Keep them away from radiators or other direct heat sources, which can deteriorate the latex.
care.step5.title: 5. Store in an appropriate location
care.step5.text: Avoid UV exposure (intense sunlight or fluorescent light) as it can impair grip and durability. Store gloves in a cool, dark, dry place â€” goalie bags are ideal.
care.step6.title: 6. Use until completely worn out
care.step6.text: Very soft palm foams can show early signs of use. The glove's performance and grip remain intact until the palm is completely worn out. Replace gloves when the palm foam is fully worn.
care.step7.title: 7. Moisten before playing
care.step7.text: Rinse Aqua gloves with warm water (preferably 35â€“40Âº) 1â€“2 hours before using to activate Hydrograinsâ„¢. Moisten all types of goalkeeper gloves before playing and keep them slightly wet during use.
